intro: Tricalysia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has pinnate leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, adapting well to seasonal drought conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in tropical and subtropical regions.
